info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 08 at 3:41AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...In northwestern Connecticut, Litchfield County, in western Massachusetts, Berkshire County, and east central New York, Albany, Columbia, Dutchess, Greene, Rensselaer, Ulster, Schoharie, and Ulster counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall and snow melt may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
